thread.title: Uniper profit drops on weaker gas optimisation business

title: Uniper profit drops on weaker gas optimisation business
text: March 8, 2018 / 6:38 AM / Updated 34 minutes ago Uniper profit drops on weaker gas optimisation business Reuters Staff 1 Min Read DUESSELDORF (Reuters) - German energy group Uniper, in which Finland’s Fortum has agreed to buy a 46.65 percent stake, on Thursday posted an 18-percent decline in full-year operating profit, citing weaker business at its gas optimisation business. FILE PHOTO: The flag of Uniper SE flutters in front of the utility's firm headquarters previously used by German utility giant E.ON in Duesseldorf, Germany, June 8, 2016. REUTERS/Wolfgang Rattay/File Photo Uniper’s full-year adjusted earnings before interest and tax (EBIT) came in at 1.11 billion euros (992.8 million pounds), slightly lower than the 1.16 billion average forecast in a Reuters poll. Reporting by Christoph Steitz; Editing by Edward Taylor
